name: MALL LINES
description: Syntax crystals are sometimes the most beautiful when split in the middle or begin to show a fracture (a space between the words). In the case of, MALL LINES, we can begin to see this fracturing between the words MALL and LINES. It's a subtle aspect, but it reminds me of diamonds that have inclusions within them, which reminds me of "The King's Diamond" of "Scratched Diamond: story that I heard when I was a child. (It's an old adage about looking at something flawed and realizing it actually is still beautiful in a different way.) Seeing the flaws within the syntax crystal reinforces and even emphasizes it's uniqueness. You could associate a narrative to this crystal or not. Just because you COULD do something, doesn't necessarily mean you have to. One thing I notice after I made this was that I could have extended the crystal; one more time with SMALL LINES. I suppose I could do an alternate version in the future; might be interesting.
